subject: The possibility to use more Runners in one JUnit class
msgSnippet: Hello everybody, please let me know, whether it is possible to define more Runner implementations in one JUnit class. In my case I would like to use both
messageBody:
Hello everybody,

please let me know, whether it is possible to define more Runner
implementations in one JUnit class.
In my case I would like to use both org.junit.runners.Parameterized and
org.mockito.runners.MockitoJUnitRunner runners. The first one because of
providing test data, the second one because of setting up Mockito mock
objects.

The current version of @RunWidth annotation can take just one Runner. Is
there any workaround to use more runners?
If not, could this feature be added in the future versions of JUnit?

Best regards,

Gabriel
